Description: Glazed composition fragment of a flared papyrus shaped neck with ivy leaf decoration from vase with an ovoid body. Upper flare not separately modelled. lower end modelled as projecting ridge. All parts were mould-made separately and attached to the body of the vessel. Decoration delicately incised into surface, and coloured a darker shade of blue green, no other decoration. Inside surface glazed, with smooth surface. Glaze pale blue green (eau de Nil), with added darker blue. Core hard buff colour.
Curator's comments: Parallels dated to the 3rd century BC (Nenna and Seif el-Din, 2000, Form T7.1; Nenna 2013, Fig. 6.5, T7.1a, see also 7.1b and c). Nenna, M.-D. 2013. Faience vessels and objects in Nicholson, P. T. (ed.) Working in Memphis: The production of faience at Roman period Kom Helul. London: Egypt Exploration Society: 106-132. Nenna, M.-D. and M. Seif el-Din. La vaisselle en faïece d’époque gréco- romaine. Études Alexandrines 4. Cairo: IFAO.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FC.11)
